# Arpeggio: add4 in A (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
This arpeggio is an add4 arpeggio in the key of A, but it is played using the C shape on the guitar. The add4 arpeggio includes the root, major third, perfect fifth, and the major fourth (or eleventh) of the chord. This particular shape of the add4 arpeggio in A offers a unique and colorful sound, adding an extra flavor to your musical compositions.

## Notes and Intervals
The notes in this arpeggio, when played in the A (Shape: C) position, include:
- A (Root)
- C# (Major Third)
- E (Perfect Fifth)
- D (Add4/Eleventh)

The intervals represented by these notes are:
- Root to Major Third: Major Third interval
- Root to Perfect Fifth: Perfect Fifth interval
- Root to Add4/Eleventh: Add4/Eleventh interval

## Musical Flavor and Genre
This add4 arpeggio played in the A (Shape: C) position provides a dreamy and ethereal quality to your music. The inclusion of the major fourth (eleventh) gives it a sense of tension and resolution, adding depth to your compositions. This arpeggio can work well in various genres such as ambient, jazz, fusion, and progressive rock where you want to introduce a more complex and colorful harmonic texture.
